text: James Robert Jones (born May 5, 1939) is an American lawyer and Democratic politician. He was a U.S. Congressman from Oklahoma between 1973 to 1987. He was the U.S. Ambassador to Mexico from 1993 to 1997.Hannemann, Carolyn G., "Jones, James Robert ," Encyclopedia of Oklahoma History and Culture (accessed May 31, 2010). From 1968 to 1969, he was acting White House Chief of Staff for the Lyndon B. Johnson administration. In 1972, after returning to Oklahoma, Jones ran for Oklahoma's 1st congressional district. He won the election and was re-elected six times. During his tenure in Congress, which lasted until 1987, Jones served four years as the Chairman of the House Budget Committee. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:Living people Category:White House Chiefs of Staff Category:Ambassadors of the United States to Mexico Category:United States representatives from Oklahoma Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Politicians from Muskogee, Oklahoma
